text: is it possible to have the Staging also to the templates i mean is it possible to "stage a two column layout" when the same live website on the same template has one column? or would the change also affect the live website and show an two column layout?
You stage the page and swap the template the staged page is using
Hi Jon, thanks, that´s what i was thinking, i just thought that there might be something i was missing :slightly_smiling_face:

Anyone here used CallRail with the HubSpot integration before?  Trying to determine if a certain tier package is required, or if all of them work with the integration.

Also, would you recommend using Call Rail for call tracking?  if not, what would you recommend instead?
It’s a good integration. Mostly targeted at folks who already use CallRail and want to add it into HubSpot. AirCall is probably our tightest calling integration FWIW
That’s great to know <@UFBNA9K9A> I’m just doing some research on behalf of a client, so I will bring up both of those options

Hi everyone, this is Jackie from the design team!  We’re working on some updates to the provider profile listing process, and we’re looking for participants to give us feedback on the designs.  Feedback sessions will be about 30 minutes long and afterward, we’ll send you a $30 gift card as a thank you for your time.  Please let me know if you might be interested!
Feel free to book some time on my calendar here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/meetings/jackie-barcamonte/HubSpot-tools-chat>
<@UA5DFM7CK> thought you might be interested
Thanks!
Thanks <@U7SL518D6> I actually already grabbed a time on <@UH0NMJZ46> ‘s calendar for Monday. Speak to you then, Jackie!
Excited to chat! Thanks guys!

Anyone else seeing an issue with the default blog RSS emails on Apple Mail? Emails with featured images set to full width are rendering at 300px wide and smaller featured images are rendering at 100px wide.

Looks fine in gmail and other mail programs. Apple mail just renders wrong now.

The issue is specific to the default RSS emails that HubSpot creates (the ones that do not have recipients as an option). These emails recently changed. There is now a Post Display Options section on these. Post Display Options are only available on the default HubSpot RSS emails that appear to have the rendering problem. On only these emails, across all of our portals, images set to full width render at 300px. Images set to a specific width render at 100px.
We have a <style> fix that resolves this (below) fro full width images. Just curios if anyone else is talking about this.
